div.p:
Rake is a software task management tool. It allows you to specify tasks and describe dependencies as well as to group tasks in a namespace.
It is similar to SCons and make, but has a number of differences.
The tool is written in the Ruby programming language, and the Rakefiles (equivalent of Makefiles in make) use Ruby syntax.
More information can be found at this website.

The plugin calls the ruby gem's "RAKE" from the command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
If you use rake to build your projects you can automate the building process and easily detect errors with our postp feature.
This plugin was developed and tested against version 0.8.7
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
This procedure allows you to build or perform task using the ruby gem called "rake"

tr.td: The directory on which the rake command will be executed
Absolute path to the rakefile you want to use. (This is the command-line '-f' option) (Required)
Provide the name of the task to be executed.
Enables full backtrace of tasks while running. (This is the command-line '--trace' option)
